alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 7:52PM CDT until June 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM CDT, radar indicated slow-moving thunderstorms with very heavy rain over far southeastern Kimble County. Rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches has already fallen, and an additional half to three quarters of an inch is expected. - Flooding of low-lying areas and along creeks is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line and The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 near Mile Marker 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 385 crossing Perdenales River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
